intro.p1: In Escondido, mailbox projects are often triggered by older equipment at long-established communities, increased package volume, and the need to meet current USPS and ADA guidelines. Postal Systems installs and replaces commercial mailbox systems for HOAs, apartments, and business parks across Escondido.
intro.p2: We handle the full scope for Escondido properties: evaluating existing mailbox locations, planning USPS-compliant layouts, providing equipment options, pouring concrete pads, setting anchors, and coordinating USPS inspection so boards and managers work with one accountable contractor.

commonProjects: New cluster box units for HOAs and townhome communities in established Escondido neighborhoods.
4C wall-mounted mailrooms for apartment buildings and mixed-use properties near major Escondido corridors.
Parcel locker additions where package volume has outgrown traditional mailbox banks.
Mailbox replacements at properties where existing equipment is rusted, leaking, or has repeated lock and door failures.
ADA-minded upgrades to improve reach, height, and approach clearances at shared mailbox locations.
whoWeWorkWith: HOAs and community associations throughout Escondido.
Apartment and multi-family communities managed by local and regional firms.
Builders and general contractors on new residential and mixed-use projects.
Owners and managers of commercial and industrial business parks in Escondido.
Schools, campuses, and municipal facilities within the City of Escondido.

faqs.question: Can you help our Escondido community replace aging mailboxes that residents are complaining about?
faqs.answer: Yes. For Escondido properties, we review your current mailbox equipment, locations, and any USPS notices or resident feedback you have received. We then recommend USPS-approved CBU or 4C solutions, coordinate layout review, and handle installation and inspection sign-off.

faqs.question: What if our existing Escondido mailbox locations are not ideal for access or parking?
faqs.answer: As part of the site visit, we look at traffic, parking, lighting, and resident access. If a new location would better serve your Escondido community and USPS delivery, we provide layout options and work with you and USPS to finalize a compliant solution.

faqs.question: How do you keep residents informed during a mailbox project in Escondido?
faqs.answer: We provide boards and managers with a clear timeline, sample notices, and key milestones so residents know when work starts, how long mail will be affected, and when new keys will be distributed. Our goal is to keep Escondido projects predictable and well-communicated from start to finish.
